alert.note: Alert for Gillespie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:39PM CDT until July 14 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Gillespie. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 638 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fredericksburg, Stonewall, Willow City, Blumenthal, Eckert, Rocky Hill, Luckenbach, Cain City, LBJ State Park, Crabapple, Albert, Grapetown, Enchanted Rock State Natural Area and LBJ National Historical Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
